meanings.definition: A country in the United Kingdom.
meanings.sent1: Wales is known for its beautiful landscapes and rich history.
meanings.sent2: I visited Wales last summer and enjoyed exploring its castles.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sheep go on vacation? To visit Wales!
meanings.sent4: The flag of Wales proudly displays a red dragon.
meanings.sent5: In Wales, you can hear the melodic sounds of Welsh choirs echoing through the valleys.

meanings.definition: To beat or flog with a stick or whip.
meanings.sent1: The cruel taskmaster wales the poor horse for no reason.
meanings.sent2: The farmer had to wales the rug to get rid of the dust.
meanings.sent3: Why did the naughty child get walesed? For drawing on the walls!
meanings.sent4: The storm wales the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The boxer wales his opponent with powerful punches in the ring.

meanings.definition: A series of ridges on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The woodworker carefully carved intricate wales into the furniture.
meanings.sent2: The artist added wales to the sculpture to create texture.
meanings.sent3: The wales on the cake made it look like a mountain range.
meanings.sent4: The hiker followed the wales of the trail up the mountain.
meanings.sent5: The potter used a tool to create wales on the clay vase for decoration.
